chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J. COLEMAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Obtain high school diploma or equivalent.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with the victim, N.J.G. DOB: 08-12-2002.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Undergo any sex offender treatment as required.

Comply with the Sex Offender Registry.

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on 09-28-2016.
Copy of Transrcipt mailed to Registar at Dodge Correctional Institution.
Original transcript is on file in case no: 15CF45.

Defendant in custody.
COMPETENCY HEARING - 
The parties have reviewed the report of Jenna Niess.  There are no additions or corrections from either party.
Attorney Kavanaugh believes that the defendant is competent to proceed in these matters.
The Court asks the defendant if he is competent and the defendant answers "he doesn't know."  Bases on this response, the Court will hear testimony from the doctor.
Testimony presented.
Based on the findings in the report and the doctors testimony today, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed in these matters.

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION OF PROBATION (CONTINUED FROM 05-24-16) - 
On count 1, degree sexual assault, the defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of eight (8) years.  That is three (3) years initial confinement followed by five (5) years extended supervision, concurrent with the sentence imposed on count 1 of 15 CF 45.
The defendant has 390 days credit per the court.
The Court finds the defendant not eligible for either the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Conditions of extended supervision on both cases:
1) AODA assessment and follow through;
2) Undergo mental health assessment and follow through;
3) Pay costs.
4) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC;
5) maintain absolute sobriety;
6) maintain fulltime employment, schooling, combination;
7) register as a sexual offender.
